article.paragraph: Use mdy datesMarch 2014Infobox personAdrian Lamo Adrian Lamo.png Adrian Lamo {{birth date and age|1981|02|20}} [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]] Adrián Lamo, R. Adrián Lamo [[Threat analyst]] {{URL|http://adrian.lamo.org/}} Mario Lamo-Jiménez and Mary Lamo-Atwood Adrian Lamo(born February 20, 1981) is aColombian-United StatesAmericanthreat analystcite webhttps://www.facebook.com/felonAdrian Lamo on FacebookAdrin LamoNovember 17, 2013November 17, 2013and formerHacker (computer security)hacker.cite webhttp://articles.washingtonpost.com/2013-06-04/world/39729591_1_hacker-adrian-lamo-ashden-fein-manning-sHacker Adrian Lamo testifies at WikiLeaks suspect Bradley Manning's court-martial[[Washington Post]]June 4, 2013September 7, 2013

Lamo first gained media attention for breaking into several high-profile computer networks, including those ofThe New York Times,Yahoo!, andMicrosoft, culminating in his 2003 arrest.cite webhttp://www.wired.com/wired/archive/12.04/hacker_pr.htmlWired 12.04: The Homeless Hacker v. The New York TimesWired.comAugust 25, 2013In 2010, Lamo reported U.S. soldier PFC Bradley Manning (now known asChelsea Manning) to federal authorities, claiming that Manning hadinternet leakleakedhundreds of thousands of sensitive U.S. government documents toWikiLeaks. Manning was arrested and incarcerated in the U.S. military justice system and later sentenced to 35 years in confinement.cite newsPoulsenKevinKevin PoulsenZetterKimKim ZetterU.S. Intelligence Analyst Arrested in Wikileaks Video Probe[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]June 6, 2010http://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2010/06/leak/June 7, 2010cite newsUS intelligence analyst arrested over security leaksBBCJune 7, 2010http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/world/asia_pacific/10254072.stmJune 7, 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100607184336/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/world/asia_pacific/10254072.stmJune 7, 2010no
article.heading: Early life and education
article.paragraph: Lamo was born inBoston,Massachusettsto Mario Lamo and Mary Atwood in 1981.cite webPalmquist Matt A Duty to Hack [[SF Weekly]] April 16, 2003 http://www.sfweekly.com/2003-04-16/news/a-duty-to-hack/full/ June 8, 2013He does not have a high school diploma.Shachtman, Noah. "He Hacks by Day, Squats by Night."Wired (magazine)Wired. March 6, 2002. Retrieved on February 24, 2014. "[...]the suits weren't about to pay attention to some hacker kid who didn't even have a high school diploma.""With Friends Like This".InformationWeek."A Duty to Hack".SF Weekly.Lamo got aGeneral Educational DevelopmentGEDand was ordered by the courtMills, Elinor. "Q&A: Adrian Lamo, the hacker philosopher."CNET. June 24, 2009. Retrieved on February 24, 2014. "In terms of higher education, I was court-ordered to attend school after I was arrested and I studied journalism at American River College in Carmichael, Calif."to take some classes atAmerican River College, a community college inSacramento County, California.cite webShachtman, NoahAdrian Lamo Cuts Deal With Fedshttp://archive.wired.com/techbiz/it/news/2004/01/61831?currentPage''Wired''1 September 2004"Q&A: Adrian Lamo, the hacker philosopher".CNET(CBS Interactive).Lamo was known as the "Homeless Hacker" for his supposedly transient lifestyle.cite webKahn, JenniferThe Homeless Hacker v. The New York Timeshttp://archive.wired.com/wired/archive/12.04/hacker_pr.htmlWired MagazineIssue 12.04April 2004Known as the Homeless Hacker before his arrest, Lamo did most of his virtual exploring from the Internet connections at Kinko's copy shops.Lamo has claimed that he has spent much of his travelsCouchSurfingcouch-surfing, squatting in abandoned buildings and traveling toInternet cafes, libraries and universities to investigate networks, and sometimes exploiting security holes.Despite performing authorized and unauthorizedvulnerability assessmentsfor several large, high-profile entities, Lamo has claimed he refused to accept payment for his services.cite webShachtman Noah He Hacks By Day, Squats By Night [[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] March 6, 2002 http://www.wired.com/culture/lifestyle/news/2002/03/50811?currentPageMarch 20, 2013cite newsFantz Ashley On WikiLeaks scandal, hacker says he didn't want to be a coward CNN July 29, 2010 http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/07/29/lamo.profile.wikileaks/index.html March 20, 2013cite webThe Week Staff Who is hacker hero Adrian Lamo [[The Week]] June 16, 2010 http://theweek.com/article/index/204061/wikileaks-who-is-hacker-hero-adrian-lamo March 20, 2013

In the mid-1990s, Lamo volunteered for the gay and lesbian media firmPlanetOut.com.cite newshttp://www.wired.com/wired/archive/12.04/hacker_pr.htmlWired 12.04: The Homeless Hacker v. The New York TimesWired.comDecember 20, 2011In 1998, Lamo was appointed to the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer and Questioning Youth Task Force by theSan Francisco Board of Supervisors.cite webhttp://www.worldtribune.com/worldtribune/WTARC/2010/ss_military0732_08_02.aspReport: U.S. Army homosexual tied to WikiLeaks scandalWorldtribune.comAugust 25, 2013cite webAgenda & Minutes Archive [[San Francisco Board of Supervisors]] August 3, 1998 http://www.sfbos.org/index.aspx?pageOctober 23, 2010 Adrian Lamo, Seat No. 10
During this period, in 2001, he overdosed on prescription amphetamines.

In a 2004 interview withWired (magazine)Wired, an ex-girlfriend of Lamo's described him as "very controlling," stating, "He carried aelectroshock weaponstun gun, which he used on me." According to the same article, a court issued a restraining order against Lamo.cite newsKahn Jennifer The Homeless Hacker v. The New York Times [[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] 2004 http://www.wired.com/wired/archive/12.04/hacker_pr.html July 8, 2010Lamo disputed the claim, writing, "I have never been subject to a restraining order in my life".cite webLamo Adrian Citability (is important!) God, Sex, & the FBI: Adrian Lamo's (alleged) blog July 10, 2010 http://pax.vox.com/library/post/citability-is-important.html July 10, 2010Dead linkOctober 2010

Lamo claimed in aWiredarticle that in May 2010, after he reported his backpack as stolen, an investigating officer noted unusual behavior and placed him under a5150 (involuntary psychiatric hold)72-hour involuntary psychiatric hold, which was extended to a nine-day hold. Lamo says he was diagnosed withAsperger syndromeat the psych ward.cite newsPoulsen Kevin Kevin Poulsen Ex-Hacker Adrian Lamo Institutionalized for Asperger's [[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] May 20, 2010 http://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2010/05/lamo/ May 23, 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100523052217/http://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2010/05/lamo/?May 23, 2010no

As of March 2011, Lamo was allegedly "in hiding," claiming that his "life was under threat" after turning in Manning.cite webHacker: Why I turned FBI Informer Al Jazeera March 16, 2011 http://english.aljazeera.net/video/americas/2011/03/2011313202019296426.html http://web.archive.org/web/20110316110645/http://english.aljazeera.net/video/americas/2011/03/2011313202019296426.htmlMarch 16, 2011no
article.heading: Activities and legal issues
article.paragraph: Lamo first became known for operatingAOLWatchdog journalismwatchdogsite Inside-AOL.com.cite webBrown Janelle Can AOL silence its critics? [[Salon.com]] July 1, 1999 http://archive.salon.com/tech/log/1999/07/01/inside_aol/ February 1, 2006cite webPoulsen Kevin Kevin Poulsen Hijackers take AIM accounts [[SecurityFocus]] November 29, 2000 http://www.securityfocus.com/news/119 February 1, 2006
article.heading: Security compromise
article.paragraph: In December 2001, Lamo was praised byWorldcomfor helping to fortify their corporate security.cite webPoulsenKevinFBI reportedly hunting Adrian Lamohttp://www.theregister.co.uk/2003/09/05/fbi_reportedly_hunting_adrian_lamo/The RegisterIn February 2002 he broke into the internal computer network ofThe New York Times, adding his name to the internal database of expert sources, and using the paper'sLexisNexisaccount to conduct research on high-profile subjects. TheNew York Timesfiled a complaint, and a warrant for Lamo's arrest was issued in August 2003 following a 15-month investigation by federal prosecutors in New York. At 10:15 AM on September 9, after spending a few days in hiding, he surrendered to theUnited States Marshals ServiceUS MarshalsinSacramento, California. He re-surrendered to theFederal Bureau of InvestigationFBIin New York City on September 11, and pled guilty to one felony count ofcomputer crimesagainstMicrosoft,LexisNexisandThe New York Timeson January 8, 2004.cite webNoahShachtmanhttp://www.wired.com/techbiz/it/news/2004/01/61831Adrian Lamo Cuts Deal With FedsWired.comAugust 25, 2013cite webKevin Poulsenhttp://www.securityfocus.com/news/7771Lamo Pleads Guilty to Times HackSecurityfocus.comJanuary 8, 2004August 25, 2013

Later in 2004, Lamo was sentenced to six months detention at his parents' home plus two years probation, and was ordered to pay roughly $65,000 in restitution. He was convicted of compromising security atThe New York TimesandMicrosoft,cite webLemos Robert Hacker helps Excite@Home toughen defenses [[CNET News]] May 29, 2001 http://news.cnet.com/2100-1001-261728.html January 21, 2006http://web.archive.org/web/20051214190759/http://news.cnet.com/2100-1001-261728.htmlDecember 14, 2005nocite webPoulsen Kevin Kevin Poulsen Proxy exposes Excite@Home data [[SecurityFocus]] May 5, 2001 http://www.securityfocus.com/news/209 April 24, 2006Yahoo!cite webPoulsen Kevin Kevin Poulsen Yahoo! News hacked [[SecurityFocus]] September 9, 2001 http://www.securityfocus.com/news/254 January 21, 2006and WorldCom.cite webPoulsen Kevin Kevin Poulsen Lamo's Adventures in WorldCom [[SecurityFocus]] December 5, 2001 http://www.securityfocus.com/news/296 January 21, 2006

When challenged for a response to allegations that he was glamorizing crime for the sake of publicity, his response was "Anything I could say about my person or my actions would only cheapen what they have to say for themselves". When approached for comment during his criminal case, Lamo frustrated reporters withnon sequitur (absurdism)non sequiturssuch as "Faith manages",cite webMcCullagh Declan Declan McCullagh The 'homeless hacker' talks [[CNET News]] September 16, 2003 http://news.cnet.com/2008-1014_3-5076942.html January 21, 2006http://web.archive.org/web/20060203153951/http://news.cnet.com/2008-1014_3-5076942.htmlFebruary 3, 2006no(probably a reference to science fiction television showBabylon 5) and "It's a beautiful day."cite webMcCullagh Declan Declan McCullagh Judge lifts hacker's PC restrictions [[CNET News]] September 12, 2003 http://news.cnet.com/Judge-lifts-hacker%27s-PC-restrictions/2100-1002_3-5076124.html January 21, 2006

At his sentencing, Lamo expressed remorse for harm he had caused through his intrusions, with the court record quoting him as adding "I want to answer for what I have done and do better with my life."cite webPoulsen Kevin Kevin Poulsen Feds say Lamo inspired other hackers [[SecurityFocus]] September 15, 2004 http://www.securityfocus.com/news/9520 January 21, 2006

He subsequently declared on the question and answer site, Quora that "We all own our actions in fullness, not just the pleasant aspects of them.". Lamo accepted that he had committed mistakes."Adrin Lamo's answer to How often do criminals hand themselves in? - Quora".
article.heading: DNA controversy
article.paragraph: On May 9, 2006, while 18 months into a two-year probation sentence, Lamo refused to give theUnited States governmenta blood sample, one that they had demanded in order to record hisDNAin theirCombined DNA Index SystemCODISsystem.cite newsPoulsen Kevin Kevin Poulsen Feds Want Hacker's Genetic Code [[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] May 10, 2006 http://www.wired.com/science/discoveries/news/2006/05/70869 January 21, 2006According to his attorney, Lamo has a religious objection to giving blood, but is willing to give his DNA in another form. On June 15, 2007, lawyers for Lamo filed a motion citing theBook of Genesisas one basis for Lamo's religious opposition to the giving of blood.

On June 21, 2007, it was reported that Lamo's legal counsel had reached a settlement agreement with the U.S.United States Department of JusticeDepartment of Justicewhereby Lamo would submit DNA viabuccal swab. According toKevin Poulsen's blog, "the Justice Department formally settled the case, filing a joint stipulation along with Lamo's federal public defender dropping the demand for blood.cite newsPoulsen Kevin Kevin Poulsen Hacker Adrian Lamo Wins, Won't Have to Give the FBI His Blood [[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] June 21, 2007 http://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2007/06/hacker-adrian-l/ June 22, 2007
article.heading: WikiLeaks and Manning
article.paragraph: see alsoChelsea ManningIn February 2009, a partial list of the anonymous donors to the WikiLeaks not-for-profit website was leaked and published on the WikiLeaks website. Some media sources indicated at the time that Lamo was among the donors on the list.cite webhttp://www.dailytech.com/Wikileaks+Forced+to+Post+Its+Own+Secrets/article14328.htmWikileaks Forced to Post Its Own SecretsDailyTechDecember 20, 2011cite webSingelRyanhttp://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2009-02/18/wikileaks-forced-to-leak-own-secret-infoWikileaks forced to leak its own secret info (Wired UK)Wired.co.ukDecember 20, 2011Wiredreported that Lamo commented on hisTwitterpage, "Thanks WikiLeaks, for leaking your donor list... That's dedication."

In May 2010,cite webPoulsenKevinhttp://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2010/06/leak/U.S. Intelligence Analyst Arrested in Wikileaks Video Probe | Threat LevelWired.comAugust 25, 2013Lamo reported to U.S. Army authorities that Manning had claimed to have leaked a large body of classified documents, including 260,000 classified United States diplomatic cables.cite newshttp://www.nytimes.com/2010/06/08/world/08leaks.html?scpThe New York TimesElisabethBumillerArmy Leak Suspect Is Turned In, by Ex-HackerJune 7, 2010Lamo stated that Manning also "took credit for leaking" the video footage of theJuly 12, 2007 Baghdad airstrike, which has since come to be known as the "Collateral Murder#Leaked video footageCollateral Murder" video.cite newsSheridan Michael Report: Soldier arrested for allegedly leaking 'Collateral Murder' helicopter video to WikiLeaks [[Daily News (New York)|New York Daily News]] June 7, 2010 http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/2010/06/07/2010-06-07_spc_bradley_manning_allegedly_arrested_for_leaking_collateral_murder_helicopter_.html June 10, 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100609062014/http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/2010/06/07/2010-06-07_spc_bradley_manning_allegedly_arrested_for_leaking_collateral_murder_helicopter_.htmlJune 9, 2010nocite newsFildes Jonathan Wikileaks site unfazed by arrest of US army 'source' BBC News June 8, 2010 http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/10265430.stm June 10, 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100610031746/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/10265430.stmJune 10, 2010no

Lamo has stated that he would not have turned Manning in "if lives weren't in danger... [Manning] was in a war zone and basically trying to vacuum up as much classified information as he could, and just throwing it up into the air."WikiLeaks responded by denouncing Lamo andWired MagazinereporterKevin Poulsenas "notorious felons, informers & manipulators" and said that "journalists should take care."

According to Andy Greenberg ofForbes,cite webhttp://blogs.forbes.com/firewall/2010/08/01/stealthy-government-contractor-monitors-u-s-internet-providers-says-it-employed-wikileaks-informant/Andy Greenberg: Stealthy Government Contractor Monitors U.S. Internet Providers, Worked With Wikileaks Informant, August 1, 2010Blogs.forbes.comAugust 25, 2013Lamo may have worked as a "security specialist" withProject Vigilant, a private security institution that works with theFBIand theNSA.FAZ.Net 4. August 2010"'Collateral Murder'-Video Erstaunliche Wendung in Sachen Wikileaks"("surprising turn in wikileaks case")Chet Uber, the head of Project Vigilant, has claimed, "I'm the one who called the U.S. government... All the people who say that Adrian is a narc, he did a patriotic thing. He sees all kinds of hacks, and he was seriously worried about people dying."

Lamo has been criticized by fellow hackers such as those at theHackers on Planet Earthconference in 2010, who called him a "Informantsnitch"."According toEric CorleyEmmanuel Goldstein, who organized the panel discussion, 90 percent of the conference was anti-Lamo."'WikiLeaks 'Snitch' Hacker Faces Wrath of His Peers',AOL NewsAnother commented to Lamo following his speech during a panel discussion saying: "From my perspective, I see what you have done as treason."cite webhttp://www.democracynow.org/2010/7/27/wikileaks_is_not_one_personwe_are"WikiLeaks Is Not One Person...We Are All the Threat" – Hacker Magazine Editor Says WikiLeaks Is Bigger Than Julian AssangeDemocracynow.orgJuly 27, 2010August 25, 2013

WikiLeaks founderJulian Assangecalls Lamo "a very disreputable character", and says that Lamo's monetary support for WikiLeaks amounted to only 20 U.S. dollars on one occasion.cite webhttp://www.wikileaks.org/WikiSecrets-Julian-Assange-Full.html"WikiSecrets" | full interview footage - See video at 21:25Wikileaks.orgMay 24, 2011August 25, 2013Assange says that it is "not right to call [Lamo] a contributor to WikiLeaks", and questions the electronic record associated with the ManningLamo chats, because, according to Assange, Lamo has "strange motivations" and "had been in a mental hospital three weeks beforehand".

Lamo has characterized his decision to work with the government as morally ambiguous but objectively necessary, writing inThe Guardian"There were no right choices that day, only less wrong ones. It was cold, it was needful, and it was no one's to make except mine," adding to The Guardian's Ed Pilkington "There were hundreds of thousands of documents let's drop the number to 250,000 to be conservative and doing nothing meant gambling that each and every one would do no harm if no warning was given."cite webLamo Adrian Bradley Manning and me: why I cannot regret turning in the WikiLeaks suspect The Guardian January 3, 2013 http://www.securityfocus.com/news/595 March 20, 2013"cite webPilkington Ed Adrian Lamo on Bradley Manning: 'I knew my actions might cost him his life' The Guardian January 3, 2013 http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2013/jan/03/adrian-lamo-bradley-manning-q-and-a March 20, 2013
article.heading: Greenwald, Lamo andWiredmagazine
article.paragraph: Lamo's role in the Manning case drew criticism fromGlenn GreenwaldofSalon Magazine. Greenwald suggested that Lamo lied to Manning by turning Manning in, and also lied after the fact to cover up the circumstances of Manning's confessions.cite webGreenwald Glenn Glenn Greenwald The strange and consequential case of Bradley Manning, Adrian Lamo and WikiLeaks [[Salon.com]] June 18, 2010 http://www.salon.com/news/opinion/glenn_greenwald/2010/06/18/wikileaks June 18, 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100621003856/http://www.salon.com/news/opinion/glenn_greenwald/2010/06/18/wikileaksJune 21, 2010noGreenwald places the incident in the context of what he calls "the Obama administration's unprecedented war on whistle-blowers".Greenwald's critique ofWired Magazinehas drawn a response from that magazine which suggests that Greenwald is writing disingenuously: "At his most reasonable, Greenwald impugns our motives, attacks the character of our staff and carefully selects his facts and sources to misrepresent the truth and generate outrage in his readership."cite webHansenEvanhttp://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2010/12/greenwald/Putting the Record Straight on the Lamo–Manning Chat Logs | Threat LevelWired.comDecember 31, 2010August 25, 2013In an article about the Manning case, Greenwald mentionsWiredreporterKevin Poulsen's 1994 felony conviction for computer hacking, suggesting that "over the years, Poulsen has served more or less as Lamo's personal media voice."Greenwald is skeptical of an earlier story written by Poulsen about Lamo's institutionalization on psychiatric grounds, writing: "Lamo claimed he was diagnosed with Asperger's Syndrome, a somewhat fashionable autism diagnosis which many stars in the computer world have also claimed."In his response, Poulsen accused Greenwald of "name-calling, bizarre conspiracy theories andad hominemattacks".

Greenwald called forWiredto release more of the chat logs in its possession that pertain to a conversation between Manning and Lamo: "there are clearly relevant parts of those chats whichWiredcontinues to conceal".Wired's editor-in-chief reiterated that "the logs include sensitive personal information with no bearing on WikiLeaks, and it would serve no purpose to publish them at this time."In an article entitled "The Worsening Journalistic Disgrace at Wired", Greenwald claimed thatWiredwas "actively conceal[ing] from the public, for months on end, the key evidence in a political story that has generated headlines around the world."cite webGreenwaldGlennhttp://www.salon.com/news/opinion/glenn_greenwald/2010/12/27/wiredThe worsening journalistic disgrace at WiredSalon.comDecember 27, 2010August 25, 2013

On July 13, 2011,Wiredpublished the logs in full, stating that "The most significant of the unpublished details have now been publicly established with sufficient authority that we no longer believe any purpose is served by withholding the logs."cite newsManning–Lamo Chat Logs RevealedEvanHansenhttp://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2011/07/manning-lamo-logs/[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]July 13, 2011July 14, 2011http://www.webcitation.org/60AvdoIoFJuly 14, 2011noGreenwald wrote of the newly released logs that in his opinion they validated his claim thatWiredhad concealed important evidence.cite newsWired publishes the full Manning–Lamo chat logsGlennGreenwaldhttp://www.salon.com/news/opinion/glenn_greenwald/2011/07/14/wired/index.htmlSalon.comJuly 14, 2011July 14, 2011nohttp://web.archive.org/web/20110715211508/http://www.salon.com/news/opinion/glenn_greenwald/2011/07/14/wired/index.htmlJuly 15, 2011
article.heading: Criticism of media coverage of Anonymous
article.paragraph: Lamo has been critical of media coverage of the hacker collectiveAnonymous (group)Anonymous, claiming that media outlets have over-hyped and mythologised the group. He also said that Anonymous is not the 'invulnerable' group it is claimed to be, and can see "no rational point in what they're doing."cite webhttp://www.ibtimes.co.uk/articles/344388/20120523/adrian-lamo-snitch-anonymous-bradley-manning-wikileaks.htmEXCLUSIVE: Hacker Adrian Lamo Who Betrayed Wikileaks' Manning Turns Fire on AnonymousGianluca MezzofioreMay 23, 2012International Business Times
article.heading: Film and television
article.paragraph: On August 22, 2002, Lamo was removed from a segment ofNBC Nightly Newswhen, after being asked to demonstrate his skills for the camera, he gained access to NBC's internal network.cite webPoulsen Kevin Kevin Poulsen Lamo Bumped from NBC After Hacking Them [[SecurityFocus]] August 27, 2002 http://www.securityfocus.com/news/595 January 2, 2007NBC was concerned that they broke the law by taping Lamo while he (possibly) broke the law. Lamo was a guest onThe Screen Saversfive times beginning in 2002.cite newsNull Christopher Christopher Null Lamo Hacks Cingular Claims Site [[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] May 29, 2003 http://www.wired.com/politics/security/news/2003/05/59024 June 15, 2010

Hackers Wanted, a documentary film focusing on Lamo's life as a hacker, was produced byTrigger Street Productions, and narrated byKevin Spacey.cite webPoulsenKevinhttp://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2010/05/hackers-wante/Lost Hacking Documentary Surfaces on Pirate Bay | Threat LevelWired.comMay 21, 2010August 25, 2013Focusing on the 2003 hacking scene, the film features interviews withKevin RoseandSteve Wozniak.The film has not been conventionally released. In May 2009, a video purporting to be a trailer forHackers Wantedwas allegedly leaked to or by Internet film site Eye Crave.cite webGoodsmith Ed Exclusive: Hackers Wanted (Documentary) Trailer! Eve Crave Network May 5, 2009 http://eyecrave.net/movies/movie/2521-exclusive-untitled-hacker-movie-can-you-hack-it-trailer/ May 6, 2009http://web.archive.org/web/20090511190501/http://eyecrave.net/movies/movie/2521-exclusive-untitled-hacker-movie-can-you-hack-it-trailer/May 11, 2009noIn May 2010, an earlier cut of the film was leaked viaBitTorrent (protocol)Bittorrent.cite webenigmax Unreleased 'Hackers Wanted' Movie Leaks To BitTorrent [[TorrentFreak]] May 20, 2010 http://torrentfreak.com/unreleased-hackers-wanted-movie-leaks-to-bittorrent-100520/ May 20, 2010According to an insider, what was leaked on the Internet was a very different film from the newer version, which includes additional footage. On June 12, 2010, a director's cut version of the film was also leaked onto torrent sites.cite webenigmax Director Sam Bozzo On BitTorrent and the Movie Industry [[TorrentFreak]] June 13, 2010 http://torrentfreak.com/director-sam-bozzo-on-bittorrent-and-the-movie-industry-100613/ June 13, 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100616060205/http://torrentfreak.com/director-sam-bozzo-on-bittorrent-and-the-movie-industry-100613/June 16, 2010no
